intro: Ottonia lancifolia, commonly known as the lanceleaf ottonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ottonia lancifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant ecosystems.
